title: I have 60mbps internet and I average 200 ping is this normal?
body: I recently switched to Spectrum from earth link and I've been getting 200 ping on the na servers with 60 mbps internet. I am located in Los Angeles and I am the only person using the internet via Ethernet. Its not a problem with the router either because i'm getting about 58 mbps download and I have a beefy asus monitor I bought a few years back. I'm wondering if that's normal or not because this internet isn't cheap and I expect more for the price. And if you do know can you help me fix this problem. Thanks.

replies.body: Hmmmm I would think you should have a lower ping than that. It might be that your ISP is just routing your connection is a rather odd way to our servers, so let's check for that first. Grab a tool like [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) to run a traceroute to our NA servers at 104.160.131.1 and post the results here!
